$

$(Condition<T>) - Static method in class fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent.Conditions
Parenthesis operator to handle priorities: $(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.host").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.host"))) .and(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.port").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.port"))) Meaning "(mail.host is defined OR mail.smtp.host is defined) AND (mail.port is defined OR mail.smtp.port is defined)".
$(Condition<Message>) - Static method in class fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent.MessageConditions
Parenthesis operator to handle priorities: $(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.host").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.host"))) .and(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.port").or(requiredProperty(propertyResolver, "mail.smtp.port"))) Meaning "(mail.host is defined OR mail.smtp.host is defined) AND (mail.port is defined OR mail.smtp.port is defined)".

and(Condition<T>...) - Static method in class fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent.Conditions
And operator between the provided conditions: and(requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport"), requiredClass("foo.Bar")); Means that the result will be true only if javax.mail.Transport and foo.Bar classes are present in the classpath.

assertThat(T, Matcher<? super T>) - Static method in class fr.sii.ogham.assertion.AssertionHelper
Copy of MatcherAssert.assertThat(Object, Matcher) with the following additions: If the matcher can provide expected value, a ComparisonFailure exception is thrown instead of AssertionError in order to display differences between expected string and actual string in the IDE.
assertThat(String, T, Matcher<? super T>) - Static method in class fr.sii.ogham.assertion.AssertionHelper
Copy of MatcherAssert.assertThat(String, Object, Matcher) with the following additions: If the matcher can provide expected value, a ComparisonFailure exception is thrown instead of AssertionError in order to display differences between expected string and actual string in the IDE.

Conditions - Class in fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent
Helper to write fluent conditions like: requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport").and(not(requiredClass("foo.Bar"))); To do this, you need to add the following static import: import static fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent.Conditions.*; If you are using Java 7, you may need to use MessageConditions instead because Java 7 doesn't resolve correctly generics chaining.

The configurer has a priority of 60000 in order to be applied after global configurer but before any sender implementation.

images() - Method in class fr.sii.ogham.email.builder.EmailBuilder
Image handling consists of defining how images are inlined in the email: Either inlining directly in the HTML content by enconding image into base64 string Or attaching the image to the email and referencing it using a Content-ID (CID) Or no inlining For example: .images() .inline() .attach() .cid() .generator(new SequentialIdGenerator()) .and() .and() .base64(); Enables both inlining modes (attaching images and encoding in base64).

message(int) - Method in class fr.sii.ogham.assertion.email.EmailsAssert
Access a particular message to write assertions for it: .message(0).subject(is("foobar")) You can use this method to chain several assertions on different messages: .message(0).subject(is("foobar")) .and() .message(1).subject(is("toto"))

Base interface for any message.
MessageConditions - Class in fr.sii.ogham.core.condition.fluent
Helper to write fluent conditions like: requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport").and(not(requiredClass("foo.Bar"))); To do this, you need to add the following static import: import static fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.condition.MessageConditions.*; This implementation is specialized for Messages that may be needed if you are using Java 7 (because generic chaining resolution doesn't work well with Java 7).

Or operator between the provided conditions: or(requiredClass("javax.mail.Transport"), requiredClass("foo.Bar")); Means that the result will be true if either javax.mail.Transport or foo.Bar class is present in the classpath.

SimpleMimetypeDetectionBuilder<P> - Class in fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.mimetype
Builds a FallbackMimeTypeProvider: If SimpleMimetypeDetectionBuilder.tika() has been called, then registers Tika as main mimetype detector If SimpleMimetypeDetectionBuilder.defaultMimetype(String...) has been called, then registers a fallback to provide a default mimetype if none of the previously registered detectors could detect mimetype If no detector has been registered a BuildException is thrown (mimetype detection is required by many Ogham components If only one detector is registered, the FallbackMimeTypeProvider is not used and instead the alone detector is directly used

smsCoding(String...) - Method in class fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh.OvhOptionsBuilder
Set the message encoding: 1 for 7bit encoding 2 for 8bit encoding (UTF-8) If you use UTF-8, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160 You can specify one or several property keys.
smsCoding(SmsCoding) - Method in class fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh.OvhOptionsBuilder
Set the message encoding: SmsCoding.NORMAL: 7bit encoding SmsCoding.UTF_8: 8bit encoding (UTF-8) If you use UTF-8, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160
